From 2019 to 2023, I worked on a PhD thesis in the field of Human Computer Interaction at the ISIR laboratory (HCI group) at Sorbonne University in Paris.

I was supervised by Yvonne Jansen and Gilles Bailly, to work on the design of tools to support knowledge sharing related to fabrication activities inside makerspaces, fablabs, workshops, and more generally the DIY community.

My thesis is part of the AfFABle project and I worked in close relationship with the Sorbonne University Fablab where I organised weekly workshops arounds different machines, prototyping, programming and crafting activities.

I defended my thesis on June 15th 2023, and you can watch the full presentation (in French) on Youtube and read the manuscript (in English) here.
